articles.title: The Secret to Longer Life? Scientists Uncover Unexpected Health Benefits of Eating Small Fish - SciTechDaily
articles.description: In Japan, people habitually eat small fish, such as whitebait, Atlantic capelin, Japanese smelt, and small dried sardines. Notably, it is common practice to consume small fish whole, including the head, bones, and organs, which are rich in micronutrients, suc…
articles.content:
Eating small fish whole can prolong life expectancy, a Japanese study finds. Credit: Chinatsu Kasahara

articles.title: Serotonin 2C Receptor Key to Memory - Neuroscience News
articles.description: Researchers discovered the serotonin 2C receptor in the brain plays a crucial role in regulating memory in both humans and animal models.

articles.title: Fossil of Neanderthal Child with Down's Syndrome Hints at Early Humans' Compassion - Good News Network
